channel.title: Comments on: d3: adding stuff. And, oh, understanding selections

item.title: By: You may not need d3 | Jerome Cukier
item.dc:creator: You may not need d3 | Jerome Cukier
item.description: […] the most intriguing and the most characteristic way to create new elements in d3js is to use a data […]
item.content:encoded: […] the most intriguing and the most characteristic way to create new elements in d3js is to use a data […]

item.title: By: jerome
item.dc:creator: jerome
item.description: it's possible to access the parent, but not straightforward. you can get by with constructs like d3.select(...).node().parentElement.__data__ but it's simpler not to.
item.content:encoded:
it’s possible to access the parent, but not straightforward. you can get by with constructs like
d3.select(…).node().parentElement.__data__ but it’s simpler not to.

item.title: By: YC
item.dc:creator: YC
item.description:
> And since you have to know: there is no easy way to retrieve the data of the parent element.
Thanks for the great tutorials, and thanks for being so thorough! Coming from protovis, I had been searching everywhere for how to do this in d3, and I'm glad I found this, so I can at least stop looking... so I'll have to rethink my data flow then!
Thanks.
item.content:encoded:
> And since you have to know: there is no easy way to retrieve the data of the parent element.

Thanks for the great tutorials, and thanks for being so thorough! Coming from protovis, I had been searching everywhere for how to do this in d3, and I’m glad I found this, so I can at least stop looking… so I’ll have to rethink my data flow then!

Thanks.

item.title: By: eerieshadow
item.dc:creator: eerieshadow
item.description: I appreciate this tutorial a lot! Finally a person that can explain selection in a quick and concise way. Thank you!
item.content:encoded: I appreciate this tutorial a lot! Finally a person that can explain selection in a quick and concise way. Thank you!

item.title: By: Donny
item.dc:creator: Donny
item.description: Thank you very much for this amazingly lucid explanation of the d3 selections. I had given up on d3 a few weeks back because I just couldn't understand the magic ..
item.content:encoded: Thank you very much for this amazingly lucid explanation of the d3 selections. I had given up on d3 a few weeks back because I just couldn’t understand the magic ..
